NERDTree is very handy for file exploring and always worth having available. Another tool worth checking out is Command-T http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=3025. If you have good familiarity with the directory you're working in, you can locate and open any file in any subdirectory using a short fuzzy pattern based on path names. Not as portable since it has some Ruby dependencies but both tools are complementary IMO.

:NERDTreeMirror - Shares an existing NERD tree, from another tab, in the current tab. Changes made to one tree are reflected in both as they are actually the same buffer.
map <F2> :NERDTreeToggle<CR>

Small tip for using NERDTree:
NERDTree comes with the NERDTreeToggle command which toggles it open.
But it opens based on your current directory. And once it's open, toggling it will open it to the same directory, even if you switched direcotries

So I have a map for Toggle and a map for Find, and when I switch between different "projects", I set the current dir to the root of the project, and use "Find" to get to my file. This also keeps the NERDTree open on my project root.
*Find* is also pretty helpful when you're just looking for where your file is in a very nested directory.

But NERDTree comes with another function called NERDTreeFind, which will open up the file you're on in the directory tree (assuming it's someone under the current dir, and not somewhere else entirely).
o, i, s - open in current, horizontal split, vertical split; go, gi, gs - same without leaving NERDTree
ma, mc, mm, md - add, copy, move, delete (file or dir/)
master those above for huge productivity benefit:)
So I have my NERDTree up and I choose a file, which opens in the right hand pane. How can I move the cursor back to NERDTree to choose a different file?
@Treffynnon C-w h or :wincmd h or :wincmd w - Basic window switching commands.
You can also use any of go, gi, or gs while in the NERDTree window to open files while keeping the cursor in the NERDTree window
I defined a shortcut so I can pop NERDTree open easily no matter which window I'm in: noremap <Leader>n :NERDTreeToggle<CR>

I'd like it if there was a way to have opening shortcuts that closed the NT window just that time.  Currently, the best workaround I have is to set NERDTreeQuitOnOpen true, and then use g* etc to leave NT open
